attributes.action: Make the education system more accessible to people with mental illness
attributes.additional_details:
Mental illness in children and teens is on the rise, and thus this issue will only become worse in time. 
Schools and colleges do not do enough to support vulnerable students, and the stigma surroundig mental illness prevents many from reaching the grades.

Reading material:
https://www.theguardian.com/education/series/mental-health-a-university-crisis
https://www.theguardian.com/education/series/mental-health-a-university-crisis
https://www.ft.com/content/8e53ee5a-1e13-11e8-aaca-4574d7dabfb6
attributes.background: With results day just passed, a number of students have been disappointed with their grades, prevented from reaching their full potential by the education system's lack of support for mentally ill students. It is completely unacceptable to allow any child's potential to be wasted.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. In particular, we're not sure how you want the education system to be made more accessible. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
